casebody.data:
CHARLES HAUSELT, for himself, &c., Plaintiff and Appellant, v. FREDERICK VILMAR and CHARLES F. TAG, Defendants and Respondents. Decided February 4, 1878.

Befdre Curtis, Ch. J., and Freedman, J.

Appeal by the plaintiff from á judgment at special term, dismissing the complaint upon the merits, and from ah order of judge at chambers, declining to entertain the plaintiff’s motion for an order requiring the judge before whom the action was tried to pass upon or find plaintiff’s proposed requests to find. The action was to vacate and set aside a general assignhient for benefit Of creditors, without preferences, on ground that same was made to defraud, hinder and delay creditors, &c. Lewis Sanders, for appellants. Ed. Solomon, for respondent, Charles F. Tag. Charles Wehle, for respondent, Frederick Vilmar. Curtis, Ch. J.,

wrote for affirmance of judgment apd order appealed from with costs.

Feeedíian, J".* concurred.
